activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sierra S. Thoms

defendant.name: Thoms, Sierra S.
defendant.address: 13638 Asaawee Ln PO Box 904, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for Sierra S. Thoms.  Attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF122, 22CF141, 22CF237 & 22TR2176 - 22TR2179. 22CF237 set for an adjourned initial appearance. Shawl has been appointed in 22CF237. Shawl states he will be appointed in other cases as well. Court received letter from Defendant on bond. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Sowinski statement to bond. Court sets signature bond - states frustration with Defendant - needs to work on attitude and behavior. Court directs Defendant to appear in person on time at next appearance. 10:14 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:58 PM Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appeared by video. Attorney Lonnie D Story appeared by video for Sierra S. Thoms. Attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF122 & 22CF141. Story states has not had contact with Defendant until today and was informed he was fired. Defendant states that is the case - does not believe he is helping her how she would like - thinks he is rude. Story states could ethically represent but if there is not communication not able to represent properly. Court statement to Defendant's request. Court will set out. Court orders Defendant to communicate with Story. Court explains appointed counsel/who has authority to fire. Defendant ordered to appear in person at next appearance. Court will not allow Defendant to fire counsel at this time. Bond continued. adj. 04:08 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
all conditions of cash bond remain

2:33 PM Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Lonnie D Story appeared by video for Sierra S. Thoms. Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion filed to amend bond - court has reviewed. Sowinski statement to bond. Court amend cash bond to a signature bond. adj. 02:38 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
granting counsel's request to appear remotely
Bail/bond hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM Defendant Jerome C. Thoms in court. Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Jerome C. Thoms. Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appears by video, in custody. Attorney Lonnie D Story appears by video for Sierra Thoms. Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22F142, 22CF122, 22CF141. Court statement. Van Ells-defendant Jerome Thoms waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver free and voluntary; finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Court notes Attorney Story has submitted written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing for Defendant Sierra Thoms-defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver free and voluntary; finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Court notes the reduction of bond motion filed in 22CF141 by Atty. Story. Sowinski notes Information will mirror criminal complaints. Van Ells willing to proceed to arraignment; speaks to bond motion lift no contact provision with Sierra. Story willing to proceed with arraignment. Van Ells - defendant pleads not guilty to all charges. Story - waives reading and defendant pleads not guilty to all charges. Story statement to bond reduction in 22CF141-requests $2,000 cash. Sowinski statement to bond reduction. Court statement - reduces bond to $3,000 cash in 22CF141, same conditions. Court strikes no contact provision in both bonds. Van Ells clarifies there is no no contact provision/withdraws bond motion. Court statement. Counsel allowed to appear by Zoom for next hearing. adj. 1:57 p.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Lonnie D Story appeared by video for Sierra S. Thoms. Calling 22CF122 & 22CF141. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - waives time limits. Defendant statement to bond. Story states he will file motion. Bail continued. adj. 01:27 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Judge re: bond reduction
No intoxicants/No taverns/No contact with K.K. & L.A./Not to go onto premises of 1029 1st Ave, Woodruff, WI)/Not possess any firearm

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sierra S. Thoms appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF122 & 22CF141. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Sowinski/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets signature bond in 22CF122 and cash bond in 22CF141. adj. 02:05 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
